marketNews.title: Inflation of the Consumer Price Index in China eased to 0.2% YoY in November 2024 (vs. October 2024: 0.3% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation which predicted 0.5% YoY inflation and marking the lowest level since June 2024. On a monthly basis, China experienced deflation of 0.6% MoM (vs. October 2024: 0.3% MoM deflation), worse than the consensus expectation which predicted 0.4% MoM deflation. This result highlights the increasing risk of deflation in China despite the stimulus packages provided by the government and central bank. Core inflation on a monthly basis was flat (vs. October 2024: 0.1% MoM deflation), while annual core inflation rose to 0.3% YoY (vs. October 2024: 0.2% YoY inflation) and marks the highest level in the last 3 months.

marketNews.title: The US Bureau of Labor Statistics recorded that non-farm payroll employment increased by 227,000 in November 2024, surpassing the consensus expectation of 200,000. This figure rose significantly from the 36,000 level in October 2024, which at that time was suppressed by the Boeing labor strike and disruptions due to Hurricanes Helene and Milton. Meanwhile, the unemployment rate in the US in November 2024 was recorded to have increased to 4.2% (vs. October 2024: 4.1%), driven by slower labor recruitment.

tickerNews.title: Unilever Indonesia ($UNVR) Further Details on Ice Cream Business Sale
tickerNews.content: On November 25, 2024, Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) announced the agreement to sell its ice cream business for IDR 7 trillion (excluding VAT), which we previously wrote about in Stockbit Commentary. UNVR has just announced further details regarding the transaction. Here are some key points: The Ice Cream Business Contributed 9.5% of Revenue in 2023, with Negative Growth - During 2019-2023, the ice cream business recorded negative sales growth of -2% CAGR, with market share dropping from 69.2% in 2019 to 61.9% in 9M24. The sales decline of the ice cream business was slightly better than the performance of UNVR's overall sales which fell -2.6% CAGR over the same period. Furthermore, UNVR also mentioned that the profitability of the ice cream business continued to decline from 11.1% in 2019 to 7.2% in 2023. A profitability of ~7% is relatively in line with what we wrote previously (mid-high single digit). The information above implies that the profit of the ice cream business was around IDR 264 billion in 2023, making the transaction valuation 26.5x P/E. Potential Additional Dividend with an Indication Yield of 5.3% - UNVR plans to distribute the net proceeds from this transaction directly to shareholders via cash dividend after the transaction is completed. Based on proforma financial statements, UNVR will record a profit of IDR 3.8 trillion (after tax) from this transaction. Assuming all is distributed as a dividend, this amount indicates a dividend yield of 5.3% based on UNVR's share price at the stock market close on Friday (6/12) at IDR 1,870 per share. However, the planned transaction completion date has not been announced as it still awaits several processes, while the GMS for transaction approval is scheduled for January 14, 2025. Key Takeaway: We assess the plan to sell the ice cream business as positive for UNVR. Amidst various challenges currently faced by the company - including in the ice cream business up to now - this divestment can make the company more focused in running its business. The transaction valuation at 26.5x P/E is also considered premium, given the resulting business performance (negative growth with lower profitability). For comparison, Campina Ice Cream Industry (CAMP) trades at a valuation of 21.4x P/E (TTM) as of the stock market close today, Monday (9/12). On this day, UNVR's share price closed higher by +1.34% at IDR 1,895 per share. *This article was first released as Stockbit Commentary on Monday (9/12) morning.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Astra International's Toyota and Daihatsu Wholesales Declined -17% YoY, -10% MoM in November 2024
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International recorded Toyota wholesales of 26,984 units (-13% YoY, -0.2% MoM) in November 2024, while Daihatsu wholesales reached 10,030 units (-26% YoY, -29% MoM). Combined, these two main brands of ASII recorded a sales performance decrease of -17% YoY and -10% MoM in November 2024, worse than the industry realization (-12% YoY, -3.7% MoM), causing their combined market share to drop to 49.8% (vs. October 2024: 53.3%, November 2023: 52.7%). Cumulatively over 11M24, Toyota's wholesale sales reached 262,315 units (-14% YoY) and Daihatsu reached 149,975 units (-14.4% YoY).

tickerNews.title: HEAL: Directors Purchase Shares
tickerNews.content: HEAL: Medikaloka Hermina Director, Yulisar Khiat and Tan Suryanti Gunadi, each bought 6.3 million shares and 80,000 shares of HEAL at an average price of 1,395.2 rupiah per share and 1,445 rupiah per share on November 21-22, 2024 and December 2, 2024, respectively. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 8.8 billion and approximately IDR 116 million, respectively. After these transactions, Yulisar's ownership in HEAL increased from 12.72% to 12.76%, while Tan Suryanti Gunadi's ownership increased from 0.028% to 0.0286%.

tickerNews.title: BYAN: Bayan Resources to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: BYAN: Bayan Resources will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 300 million US dollars or 0.009 US dollars per share, equivalent to 142.8 rupiah per share assuming an exchange rate of 15,861 rupiah to the US dollar. The cum date in the regular and negotiated market is December 17, 2024, with payment on January 8, 2025. Referring to BYAN's share price at the close of trading on Monday (9/12) at 19,900 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 0.72%.

tickerNews.title: SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa Increases Stake in NRCA
tickerNews.content: SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa purchased approximately 14.8 million shares of Nusa Raya Cipta (NRCA) at a price of 360 rupiah per share from its subsidiary, PT Enercon Paradhya International, on December 4, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 5.3 billion. After this transaction, SSIA's ownership in NRCA increased from 63.35% to 64.36%.

tickerNews.title: SGER: Entering Mineral Commodity Trading Business
tickerNews.content: SGER: Sumber Global Energy President Director, Welly Thomas, stated that the company will operate a metal commodity trading business - such as silver and copper - through its Singapore-based subsidiary, Hineni Resources Pte. Ltd. Welly mentioned that this diversification is intended to develop SGER's business model into a more diverse commodity company, beyond its main focus on coal trading.

tickerNews.title: MSJA: Controlling Shareholder Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: MSJA: The controller of Multi Spunindo Jaya, PT Maju Selaras Jaya Merta, bought 187.5 million shares of MSJA at a price of 350 rupiah per share on December 3-5, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 65.6 billion. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Maju Selaras Jaya Merta in MSJA increased from 54.91% to 58.1%.

tickerNews.title: NSSS: Shareholder Increases Stake to Near Majority
tickerNews.content: NSSS: Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera shareholder, PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama, bought approximately 2.6 billion shares of NSSS at an average price of 190 rupiah per share on November 28, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 488 billion. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama in NSSS increased from 38.83% to 49.64%.

tickerNews.title: SAMF: Saraswanti Anugerah Makmur Plans Stock Split
tickerNews.content: SAMF: Saraswanti Anugerah Makmur plans a stock split with a ratio of 1:2. The first trading of shares with the new nominal value in the regular market and negotiated market will commence on February 6, 2025. This plan will be discussed in the GMSLB on January 16, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CNKO: Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. Becomes New Controlling Shareholder After Acquiring Shares
tickerNews.content: Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. bought 896 million shares of Exploitasi Energi Indonesia (CNKO) at a price of 7 rupiah per share on December 2-4, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately IDR 6.3 billion. After this transaction, the ownership of Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. in CNKO increased from none to 10%, and became the company's new controller. Subsequently, Anderson Bay Pte. Ltd. will execute a mandatory tender offer.
